abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Emergency Support for Social Services Project for Guatemala
            is to preserve health and education services following
            severe flooding and other natural disasters that took place
            in Guatemala between May and September 2010. This is the
            second restructuring of the project to facilitate the
            disbursement of the remaining loan proceeds within the 2012
            budget and improve the monitoring of the project outcomes.
            The changes include a reallocation of loan proceeds among
            existing categories as well as a revision of the results
            framework. The first restructuring, approved in May 2012,
            extended the project closing date from June 30, 2012 to
            December 31, 2012, to give the Borrower a full year of
            project implementation following a delay in the loan's
            congressional approval.
